page.title: 09LIFESTYLE 4 - A WORKER
page.content: MY DAD, MR BARNES, WORKS AT PAUL'S AGRICULTURAL ANIMAL FEED AT WALTON SUMMIT. HE STARTS WORK AS A LORRY DRIVER AT 6.30AM IN THE MORNING, BY LOADING HIS LORRY AND SETTING HIS TACHOGRAPH, WHICH RECORDS HOW LONG HE DRIVES, THE SPEED OF THE LORRY AND ANY STOPS HE MAKES. THIS IS REQUIRED BY LAW. HE DELIVERS ANIMAL FOODS TO MANY AREAS INCLUDING CUMBRIA,DUMFRIES AND PENRITH AS WELL AS FAIRLY LOCALLY. HIS LORRY IS KNOWN AS A "SUCKER-BLOWER" WHICH MEANS THAT IT CAN SUCK IN FEED AND ALSO BLOW IT OUT AT THE DELIVERY POINT. HE CARRIES A WIDE VARIETY OF ANIMAL FEEDS FOR BOTH CATTLE AND POULTRY. WHEN HE ARRIVES BACK AT THE MILL HE GIVES HIS MILEAGE READING TO THE OFFICE AND THEN, IF HE HAS THE TIME, LOADS HIS LORRY FOR THE NEXT DAY'S WORK.I WOULD LIKE TO WORK WITH HIM WHEN I AM OLDER.
